007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a partial right circular cone with its
016   base parallel to the xz-plane and its apex on the positive y-axis.
017<p>
018   By a partial cone we mean a cone over a circular sector of the
019   cone's base and also cutting off the top part of the cone (the
020   part between the apex and a circle of latitude) leaving a frustum
021   of the (partial) cone.
022
023   @see Cone
024   @see ConeFrustum
025   @see CircleSector
026   @see DiskSector
027   @see RingSector
028   @see CylinderSector
029   @see SphereSector
030   @see TorusSector
031*/
032public class ConeSector extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
033{
034   public final double r;
035   public final double h;
036   public final double t;
037   public final double theta1;
038   public final double theta2;
039   public final int n;
040   public final int k;
041   public final MeshType type;
042
043   /**
044      Create half of a right circular cone with its base in the xz-plane,
045      a base radius of 1, height 1, and apex on the positive y-axis.
046   */
047   public ConeSector( )
048   {
049      this(1, 1, Math.PI/2, 3*Math.PI/2, 15, 8);
050   }
051
052
053   /**
054      Create a part of the cone with its base in the xz-plane,
055      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code h}, and apex
056      on the y-axis.
057   <p>
058      The partial cone is a cone over the circular sector
059      from angle {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
060      counterclockwise direction). In other words, the (partial)
061      circles of latitude in the model extend from angle
062      {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
063      counterclockwise direction).
064   <p>
065      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
066      and the number of (partial) circles of latitude in the model.
067   <p>
068      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
069      the bottom edge), then each line of longitude will have {@code n}
070      line segments. If there are {@code k} lines of longitude, then each
071      (partial) circle of latitude will have {@code k-1} line segments.
072   <p>
073      There must be at least four lines of longitude and at least
074      one circle of latitude.
075
076      @param r       radius of the base in the xz-plane
077      @param h       height of the apex on the y-axis
078      @param theta1  beginning longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
079      @param theta2  ending longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
080      @param n       number of circles of latitude around the cone
081      @param k       number of lines of longitude
082      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
083      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
084   */
085   public ConeSector(final double r,
086                     final double h,
087                     final double theta1, final double theta2,
088                     final int n, final int k)
089   {
090      this(r, h, h, theta1, theta2, n+1, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
091   }
092
093
094   /**
095      Create a part of the cone with its base in the xz-plane,
096      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code  h}, and apex
097      on the y-axis.
098   <p>
099      If {@code 0 < t < h}, then the partial cone is a frustum
100      with its base in the xz-plane and the top of the frustum at
101      {@code y = t}.
102   <p>
103      The partial cone is a cone over the circular sector
104      from angle {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
105      counterclockwise direction). In other words, the (partial)
106      circles of latitude in the model extend from angle
107      {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
108      counterclockwise direction).
109   <p>
110      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
111      (not counting one edge of any removed sector) and the number of
112      (partial) circles of latitude (not counting the top edge of the
113      frustum) in the model.
114   <p>
115      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
116      the bottom edge but not the top edge of the frustum), then each
117      line of longitude will have {@code n+1} line segments. If there are
118      {@code k} lines of longitude (not counting one edge of any removed
119      sector), then each (partial) circle of latitude will have {@code k}
120      line segments.
121   <p>
122      There must be at least four lines of longitude and at least
123      two circles of latitude.
124
125      @param r       radius of the base in the xz-plane
126      @param h       height of the apex on the y-axis
127      @param t       top of the frustum of the come
128      @param theta1  beginning longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
129      @param theta2  ending longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
130      @param n       number of circles of latitude around the cone
131      @param k       number of lines of longitude
132      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
133      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
134      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code h} is less than {@code t}
135   */
136   public ConeSector(final double r,
137                     final double h,
138                     final double t,
139                     double theta1, double theta2,
140                     final int n, final int k)
141   {
142      this(r, h, t, theta1, theta2, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
143   }
144
145
146   /**
147      Create a part of the cone with its base in the xz-plane,
148      a base radius of {@code r}, height {@code  h}, and apex
149      on the y-axis.
150   <p>
151      If {@code 0 < t < h}, then the partial cone is a frustum
152      with its base in the xz-plane and the top of the frustum at
153      {@code y = t}.
154   <p>
155      The partial cone is a cone over the circular sector
156      from angle {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
157      counterclockwise direction). In other words, the (partial)
158      circles of latitude in the model extend from angle
159      {@code theta1} to angle {@code theta2} (in the
160      counterclockwise direction).
161   <p>
162      The last two integer parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
163      (not counting one edge of any removed sector) and the number of
164      (partial) circles of latitude (not counting the top edge of the
165      frustum) in the model.
166   <p>
167      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
168      the bottom edge but not the top edge of the frustum), then each
169      line of longitude will have {@code n+1} line segments. If there are
170      {@code k} lines of longitude (not counting one edge of any removed
171      sector), then each (partial) circle of latitude will have {@code k}
172      line segments.
173   <p>
174      There must be at least four lines of longitude and at least
175      two circles of latitude.
176
177      @param r       radius of the base in the xz-plane
178      @param h       height of the apex on the y-axis
179      @param t       top of the frustum of the come
180      @param theta1  beginning longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
181      @param theta2  ending longitude angle of the sector (in radians)
182      @param n       number of circles of latitude around the cone
183      @param k       number of lines of longitude
184      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
185      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
186      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
187      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code h} is less than {@code t}
188   */
189   public ConeSector(final double r,
190                     final double h,
191                     final double t,
192                     double theta1, double theta2,
193                     final int n, final int k,
194                     final MeshType type)
195   {
196      super(String.format("Cone Sector(%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)",
197                                       r, h, t, theta1, theta2, n, k));
198
199      if (n < 2)
200         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
201      if (k < 4)
202         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 3");
203      if (h < t)
204         throw new IllegalArgumentException("h must be greater than or equal to t");
205
206      theta1 = theta1 % (2*Math.PI);
207      theta2 = theta2 % (2*Math.PI);
208      if (theta1 < 0) theta1 = 2*Math.PI + theta1;
209      if (theta2 < 0) theta2 = 2*Math.PI + theta2;
210      if (theta2 <= theta1) theta2 = theta2 + 2*Math.PI;
211
212      this.r = r;
213      this.h = h;
214      this.t = t;
215      this.theta1 = theta1;
216      this.theta2 = theta2;
217      this.n = n;
218      this.k = k;
219      this.type = type;
220
221      // Create the cone's geometry.
222
223      final double deltaH = t / (n - 1),
224                   deltaTheta = (theta2 - theta1) / (k - 1);
225
226      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
227      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
228
229      // Create all the vertices (working from the bottom to the top).
230      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose an angle of longitude
231      {
232         final double c = Math.cos(theta1 + j * deltaTheta),
233                      s = Math.sin(theta1 + j * deltaTheta);
234         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
235         {
236            final double slantRadius = r * (1 - i * deltaH / h);
237            v[i][j] = new Vertex(slantRadius * c,
238                                 i * deltaH,
239                                 slantRadius * s );
240         }
241      }
242      final Vertex apex         = new Vertex(0, t, 0),
243                   bottomCenter = new Vertex(0, 0, 0);
244
245      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
246      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
247      {
248         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
249         {
250            addVertex( v[i][j] );
251         }
252      }
253      addVertex(bottomCenter);
254      final int bottomCenterIndex = n * k;
255//    addVertex(apex);
256//    final int apexIndex = bottomCenterIndex + 1;
257
258      // Create all the triangle strips along the cone wall.
259      // If t == h2, then this code will put degenerate triangles into
260      // the triangle strip at the top (which should be a triangle fan).
261      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
262      {
263         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
264         {
265            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
266            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
267            {
268               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j);  // v[i  ][j]
269               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j);  // v[i+1][j]
270            }
271            addPrimitive(triStrip);
272         }
273      }
274      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
275      {
276         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
277         {
278            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
279            triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
280            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
281            {
282               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
283               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
284            }
285            addPrimitive(triStrip);
286         }
287      }
288      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
289      {
290         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
291         {
292            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
293            {
294               addPrimitive(
295                  new TriangleStrip(   i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
296                                    (1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
297                                       i * k + j + 1,   // v[i  ][j+1]
298                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1)); // v[i+1][j+1]
299            }
300         }
301      }
302
303      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
304        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
305      {
306         // Create the triangle fan at the bottom.
307         final Primitive botFan = new TriangleFan();
308         botFan.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
309         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
310         {
311            botFan.addIndex( j );  // v[0][j]
312         }
313         addPrimitive(botFan);
314      }
315
316//      // Create the triangle fan at the top.
317//      final Primitive topFan = new TriangleFan();
318//      topFan.addIndex(apexIndex);
319//      for (int j = k - 1; j >= 0; --j)
320//      {
321//          topFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+j );  // v[n-1][j]
322//      }
323//      topFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+k-1 );  // v[n-1][k-1]
324//      addPrimitive(topFan);
325   }
326
327
328
329   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
330   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
331
332   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
333
334   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
335
336   @Override
337   public ConeSector remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
338   {
339      return new ConeSector(this.r,
340                            this.h,
341                            this.t,
342                            this.theta1, this.theta2,
343                            n, k,
344                            type);
345   }
346}//ConeSector
